controller

Interface IMainController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MainController

    public interface IMainController
    Author:
    Giacomo Scaparrotti This is the Main Controller of the entire application. Its presence is mandatory. Its purpose is providing all the needed objects, such as the menu or the instance of the Restaurant class, and managing the file I/O, which is to say, saving and loading the application's data from the file system. It also dispatches the other controllers to the respective views, calling the relative methods or providing an ad-hoc method (see the methods' doc for further details).

    • Method Detail

      • setModel

        void setModel(IRestaurant model,
              IMenu menu)
        Parameters:
        model - an IRestaurant instance
        menu - an IMenu instance Set the model classes which will be used during the execution of the program. It is mandatory to call this method every time you create a new instance of this class.

      • setMainViewAndControllers

        void setMainViewAndControllers(IRestaurantView view,
                               IMainViewController viewCtrl,
                               IDialogController dialogCtrl)
        Parameters:
        view - The IRestaurantView instance used in the program.
        viewCtrl - Your IMainViewController, which controls the view.
        dialogCtrl - Your IDialogController, which will control the ITableDialog instances. Sets the main view and the related controllers.

      • getDialogController

        IDialogController getDialogController()
        Returns:
        the prevoiously set IDialogController instance. Provides the IDialogController which will be used when creating a new ITableDialog. Before calling this method, you must have called the setMainViewAndControllers(IRestaurantView, IMainViewController, IDialogController) method at least once, otherwise the behaviour of this method is undefined.

      • getRestaurant

        IRestaurant getRestaurant()
        Returns:
        The previously set IRestaurant instance

      • getMenu

        IMenu getMenu()
        Returns:
        The previously set IMenu instance

      • commandLoad

        int commandLoad()
        Returns:
        the amount of loaded tables, or -1 if the loading failed. Loads a previously saved status of the program. If the loading fails, -1 will be returned, otherwise, the method will return the amount of tables in the loaded file.

      • commandSave

        void commandSave()
        Saves the entire status of the program. You will likely call this method at the exit of the program.

      • autoSave

        void autoSave()
        Checks if the autosaving option is selected, and if so, saves the status of the program.

      • showMessageOnMainView

        void showMessageOnMainView(java.lang.String message)
        Parameters:
        message - a String containing the message Shows a generic message on the main view. You can use this method to show any kind of information, such as notifications or soft errors. If you want to show a severe error, use the showIrreversibleErrorOnMainView(String) method.

      • showIrreversibleErrorOnMainView

        void showIrreversibleErrorOnMainView(java.lang.String message)
        Parameters:
        message - a String containing the error description Shows a severe error on the main view.
